chunks.en: What should I do if I don't want to lose my cat?

I checked this morning and found that asthma is caused by cat hair allergies.
The doctor suggested giving the cat away.

It is currently reversible, but if it continues, the asthma will become irreversible.
Another option is to get allergy shots, but it's not a cure. You have to keep getting them as long as you have the cat, once a month.
I'm not that attached to the cat, but my wife doesn't want to give it away. My current plan is to stay away from the cat as much as possible at home, use the robot vacuum cleaner frequently, wear a mask as much as possible, and keep the cat out of the bedroom.
Any suggestions?
Your wife would rather see you suffer than get rid of the cat? I suggest getting a new wife.
People are more important than cats.
The doctor has already confirmed that the cat is the allergen, what's there to miss?
If your wife refuses to give it away, let her live with the cat.
It's best not to have a cat. You can't wear a mask all the time at home, or stay in the bedroom all the time.
Doesn't your wife care about your health at all?
In her opinion, is your health less important than a cat?
Let's put it this way, if your wife had asthma and you weren't willing to give the cat away, and your wife posted this on Xiaohongshu, you could prepare to disappear from the internet.

There are many solutions now. One is hypoallergenic cat food, two is allergy shots for people, and three is finding a way to coexist with asthma. Removing the cat isn't a magic bullet. Even if you remove the cat, colleagues and even strangers will still have cats. There are still stray cats outside, and 'secondhand cat' is always floating in the air.

Cat allergy is just one trigger. This time it's cats, next time it might be pollen, dust mites, or some kind of plant, or just cold air. Whether or not you remove the cat, you face living with asthma.
I suggest you first try to see if leaving the cat has an immediate effect, and then proceed slowly.

Even if leaving the cat has an immediate effect, I suggest you get desensitized, after all you are still young. Now it is your wife who has a cat, so you can reason with her. What if your child wants to have a cat in the future?
People with cat allergies can only be villains in cartoons, okay?
Think of it this way, in a dormitory, someone is slowly poisoning you every day, but you are willing to accept it because you like their appearance.
Asthma doesn't kill people, a lifetime of asthma isn't a big deal.
If you don't want to lose it, then put up with it. Anyway, it's not the netizens who have allergies and asthma. ğŸ¶
The stereotype of childless, cat-loving women is constantly reinforced.
Get a hairless cat, or live separately.
1. Get a separate cat room / cage.
2. Give it away.
3. Respect natural selection. If you can become desensitized, you survive. If you can't, then...ğŸ¶ğŸ¶ğŸ¶
Your body is 100% your own, your wife and cat are not necessarily.

I used to have cats in Hangzhou and it was fine, but later I went back to Beijing and slowly started to become allergic to cats. Now, being in the same room with a cat for a short time will cause me to sneeze violently, have itchy eyes, and a swollen throat. It's terrible. I've tried wearing a mask, but it's useless.
When I feel uncomfortable, I go to the hallway to get some air, which helps a little. Normally, I need to stay outside for about an hour to recover and get rid of the red eyes.
Swelling of the upper respiratory tract also has the risk of suffocation. If it doesn't work out, brother, let's get together.
It's normal for the cat not to want to be given away, the problem is that your wife doesn't care about you.
If your wife really cared about you, the question of whether or not she's willing wouldn't even exist.
All your current thoughts are because you love her. You are restraining everything and hurting yourself.

If you really love your wife, you should teach her to be reasonable and tell her that this cat is not only harming your body, but also harming your relationship and distorting the values that you both uphold as a couple.
@aisles1 #14 Exactly, just asthma, how is it more important than a cat; even if asthma kills you, people are going to die sooner or later anyway. ğŸ¶
@lengmou A scheming 0000000
Even if they are just two pets, if they conflict with each other, you should separate them.
Your status < pet
Send it back to your hometown for your parents to raise.
Before you have a solution, put clothes on the cat and change them every 3 days. It will reduce a lot of hair.
